New Records: Cleveland Cavaliers became the sixth team in league history to win its first 14 games and the first since the 2015-16 Golden State Warriors.
The 14-game winning streak is the longest in Cleveland Cavaliers' club history.
Kenny Atkinson now has the longest winning streak of any coach with a new team, surpassing Lawrence Frank's 13-game streak.
Key Match Events: Donovan Mitchell scored a season-high 37 points, including 18 in the fourth quarter.
Cleveland Cavaliers closed the game with a 21-7 run, known as a 'Cav-a-lanche'.
Substitute Caris LeVert and Donovan Mitchell both hit 3-pointers in the final minutes to secure the win.
Post-Match Reflections: Donovan Mitchell expressed surprise and enjoyment at the appearance of the frog mascot.
Kenny Atkinson emphasized the importance of continuous improvement despite the team's perfect record.
Draymond Green praised the Cavaliers' ball movement, comparing it to the Golden State Warriors' style.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cavaliers celebrated their win by dancing with a giant green frog mascot on the court.
Cleveland played without starting forward Evan Mobley.
The game was an NBA Cup opener.
